title: Watch Out Festival
description:
Hosted by bearded Drag Queen Timberlina, we’ll have the first showing of the Cambridge Junction commissioned Little Wimmin by Figs in Wigs and in our music venue we’ll be presenting Rachael Young’s Afro Futurist show about Grace Jones’ seminal album Nightclubbing. Mouthpiece from Canada will be stopping off in Cambridge on their international tour, Brian Lobel has worked with local LGBT+ artists to make their own one on one performances, and DJ queer female collective YOU KNOW IT MAKES SENSE will be playing tunes all day/night.

Watch Out Festival

Anna Brownsted: My Vinyl’s Ate Your Mp3s
Collusion: VR Playtime
Cruising for Art
Figs in Wigs: Little Wimmin
Made in China: Super Duper Close Up
Quote Unquote Collective /Why Not Theatre: Mouthpiece
Rachael Young: NIGHTCLUBBING
Roxanne Carney: I’m the Hero of This Story
Seke Chimutengwende and Alexandrina Hemsley: Black Holes
Hosted by Timberlina
DJ Collective: You Know it Makes Sense
